ai.summary: Heritage 100 - Ushaw Moor is a challenging 16.3 km hike in the UK, offering a mix of country lanes and potential moorland sections. The route is rated hard due to distance, elevation changes, and variable conditions, suitable for experienced hikers with good navigation and fitness.
ai.terrain_summary: The trail traverses a mix of surfaced paths, rural lanes, and unpaved moorland sections. Expect uneven footing, potential mud, and some exposed segments with modest to steep climbs. Navigation is important as the route may include cross-paths.
ai.safety_notes: Carry enough water and food for 16.3 km. Wear sturdy boots and weather-appropriate layers. Check local conditions; UK weather can change rapidly. Bring a map, compass or GPS, and a fully charged phone. Let someone know your plan with estimated return time. Stay on marked paths, watch for traffic on road sections, and be mindful of livestock or crops near fields.
recommended_gear: Map and compass or GPS device
ai.best_seasons: Late spring to early autumn (roughly March to October); summer offers longer daylight and generally drier conditions, but UK weather can vary.
